page.title: 08Camber Castle.
page.content: {Camber Castle is not in the {village of Camber.}It was built on the western side of the river Rother between Rye and Winchelsea Beach,as part of Henry VIII's coastal defences.The design of the castle is {flower-shaped}with rounded bastions and in the 16th century it was in a good position to guard Rye Bay.The sea has since retreated and the castle is now{a mile}or so inland. Camber Castle has been closed for many years but is hoped to open part of it in{1986-87.}Re-opening has been delayed because of frost damage to the keep.It is being restored by English Heritage and finds at the castle include a{gold ring worth Â£7,000,}a pike,a musket,a breech-loading gun and a ceramic cooking stove. *************************
